snippet: The judge in the concussion settlement case took exception to a clause that would keep players who receive a cash payout from suing the N.C.A.A.
abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody, rejecting $765 million NFL concussion lawsuit settlement on grounds that it might not cover all future players, also takes exception to clause that would preclude players who receive payout from suing the NCAA or amateur football organizations.

byline.original: By STEVE EDER and KEN BELSON

lead_paragraph: The judge in the concussion settlement case took exception to a clause that would keep players who receive a cash payout from suing the N.C.A.A.

headline.main: In N.F.L. Suit, Judge Flags Provision Protecting N.C.A.A.
